title: Top 7 facts from AWSxDatadog hackathon discord chat

facts.text: The event organizers posted a full prize breakdown for AWS, Datadog, Neo4j, MiniMax, and TestSprite tracks during the day.
facts.rationale: A single organizer message contains all track tiers and prizes with clearly formatted amounts for each category.

facts.text: Some participants had private marketplace and IAM permission failures when attempting Bedrock access during setup.
facts.rationale: Multiple users pasted concrete errors showing denied model access and role-policy rejection for Bedrock operations.

excerpts: is not authorized to perform: bedrock:CreateAgent
IAM WSParticipantRole says us-west-2 us-east-1 cannot be used

facts.text: Team members requested a direct AWS support contact for Bedrock/IAM issues and asked if a designated technical support channel existed.
facts.rationale: Several asks were explicitly directed at finding official support during the account/permission failure period.

excerpts: designated AWS point of contact or tech support channel

facts.text: Participants reported that Bedrock inference calls were possible, but deploying services like EC2 was not working under their account permissions.
facts.rationale: This is corroborated by multiple messages where one user claimed inference success and another explicitly noted inability to spin up EC2.

excerpts: I tested, I can use bedrock with no issue
it doesn't let me to spin up ec2
No ECR, ECS , EC2 etc permissions

facts.text: At least one user reported not seeing any reliable deployment path and could not deploy ECS despite asking for help.
facts.rationale: There are messages describing service deployment errors even after another user suggested ECS might be possible.

excerpts: No ECR, ECS , EC2 etc permissions
Ohh were you able to use it? For my setup its giving permission error only
Had to go to AWS table and got help

facts.text: CopilotKit announced an updated prize to a pair of Meta Ray-Ban glasses for each member of the top two teams.
facts.rationale: The organizer posted an explicit correction to the CopilotKit award format in the same minute-level channel updates.

excerpts: CopilotKit has updated their prizes to: Top two teams will each receive a pair of Meta Ray Bans

facts.text: Lenka confirmed that participants should submit GitHub link, demo video, track selections, and product answers in the event submission form.
facts.rationale: This was the direct checklist response from the organizer in reply to repeated submission questions.

excerpts: submit your Github link, a demo video, pick your tracks, and answer the questions
